summary:
As legal counsel/business lawyer I love my field of work. Going the extra mile to make a difference for my clients is what matters to me. It has helped me to win a considerable part of the court cases in which I represented my clients. 

As a person, I am outgoing, dedicated and thorough in counselling and preparing cases. I enjoy study, travel, meeting people and venturing out of my comfort zone. I thrive best in an international, fast paced business setting providing services in corporate law, civil law, contract law and labor law.

location.default: Berkel en Rodenrijs, South Holland, Netherlands

education.field_of_study: Labour Law and Labour Procedure Law

school.name: ETEC - Escola Técnica Estadual de São Paulo

certifications.name: Licensed Lawyer São Paulo - Brazil
certifications.authority: OAB - Ordem dos Advogados do Brasil

company.name: OAB - Ordem dos Advogados do Brasil

profile_positions.description:
Main responsibilities:
- Provide pre and post deal commercial advice to traders with respect to the commercial, contractual and financial risks associated with their business, identifying areas where there are opportunities for value creation as well as areas where the exposure to value leakage exists.
- Advise traders of the commercial and contractual risk associated with their business and ensure that contracts/agreements drafted are fit for purpose.
 - Authorise and draft outgoing contracts and responses to incoming contracts, before dispatch to the counterparty.
- Provide advice to the business when negotiating complex contractual arrangements/framework contracts/storage agreements etc.
- Acting as a first line of defense in ensuring compliance with Shell’s Control Framework, protecting Shell’s license to operate by ensuring/verifying that all contracts comply with all local implementation policies, manual of authorities, business controls, Shell Group policy and standards as well as meeting all regulatory and regulated market requirements
- Provide advice and help in resolving contractual disputes with counterparties, liaising with corporate legal counsels as necessary.
- Maintain an awareness of any new trade opportunities and regulatory restrictions that may involve changes to existing procedures or support processes.
- Prepare and negotiate ad hoc agreements needed to facilitate new business and structured transactions.
- Assist in maintaining a contract and clause database, as well as manage an efficient status reporting mechanism.
- Reviewing and negotiating amendments to 3rd Party General Terms and Conditions.
- Assist in refining/revising current contracts processes in line with those of other functions (e.g. Settlements) to reduce profit leakage and ensure optimal efficiency.
profile_positions.title: Senior Commercial Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Shell is an international energy company with expertise in the exploration, production, refining and marketing of oil and natural gas, and the manufacturing and marketing of chemicals. The trading department is one of the world´s largest energy traders and is a segment of the Royal Dutch Shell portfolio integrating a worldwide trading network with an unsurpassed global portfolio in Crude Oil, Refined Oil Products, LPG, Gas, Power & Environmental Products.
 
Main responsibilities:
• Ensure the supply-chain is kept feasible in the most cost efficient way and all contractual (Incoterms, GT&C, credit guarantee / SLC) and operational (Nomination / MSDS) obligations arising from contracts are carried out.
• Co-ordinate naphtha movements via pipeline, vessels, barges, trains and depot stocks in supply portfolio.
• Maintain company stocks in the allocated locations within specified limits and contractual requirements striving to minimize working capital & transport costs whilst meeting HSSE and legislative standards.
• Close liaison with traders, supply optimizers, source refineries, terminals, pipeline operators, exchange partners, and distribution operations to ensure replenishments are accomplished optimally when the need to react to both internal and external events occurs.
• Manage operational aspects of the Supply and Terminal agreements with third parties.
• Capture non-conformance, supply, quality and HSSE incidents.
profile_positions.title: Trading Operator

company.name: Metro Group Food Sourcing - Rotterdam Trading Office B.V.

profile_positions.company: METRO Food Sourcing - Rotterdam Trading Office B.V.
profile_positions.description:
METRO is a leading international specialist company in the wholesale and modern food retail. The company provides custom solutions to meet the local and international needs of its wholesale and retail customers. As a professional sourcing organization, it provides international procurement solutions to the sales brands of METRO as well as third party customers outside METRO.

Main responsibilities:
•	Analyze / review contracts and legal documents for listing new suppliers.
•	Dispute resolution – Intermediate and settle disputes between customers and suppliers.
•	Manage the whole procedure of listing a new article (request and analyze products specifications and certificates).
•	Analyze and apply the correct Incoterms in each trade procedure.
•	Participation in the EU-Breeds (Ireland, France, Belgium, Spain) sourcing, assisting negotiations and ordering process on a regular base.
•	Support of the entire commercial/trading transaction (sourcing & sales cycle) in assigned meat categories.
•	Assist and support the traders during supplier and article negotiations.
•	Coordinate assortment demands, execute goods orders within Trading Office’s meat network.
•	Support daily business with Metro countries including price alignments, ordering (purchase order, sell order, transport order and dispatch advice) and exports.
profile_positions.title: Sourcing and Selling Associate

profile_positions.description:
Braskem is a multinational company, the largest petrochemical company in Latin America and has become a major player in the international petrochemical market as it is the 8th largest resin producer worldwide. With industrial plants spread across Brazil, US, Mexico and Germany, the company produces over 16 million tons of thermoplastic resins and other petrochemicals per year. 

Main responsibilities:
•	Support drafting, revising and writing contractual and other legal documents, power of attorney etc.
•	Provide legal advice, guidance and practical solutions on a variety of topics/issues related to contract law, employment law, corporate law, etc.
•	Support the development of strategies, policies and internal documentation (templates and training material).
•	Support the financial team booking invoices (BPM, CITRIX), following up payments and drafting legal documents regarding the received reminders in order to avoid it to reach the legal department.
profile_positions.title: Paralegal

profile_positions.description:
Franco & Ruela is a law firm that I started with a business partner in 2016. We set it up as a lean firm, so without the “usual overhead” in order to be competitive and agile. Over time, we expanded from 2 to (2018) 5 lawyers working for the firm dealing with all law fields (civil law, contract law, corporate law labor law and family law). One of the unique selling points of Franco & Ruela is the highly personal service, commitment and attention delivered to all clients. 

Main responsibilities:
•	Set up this law firm specifically focusing on structuring administration and accounting.
•	Reach out to and build relationships with (corporate) prospects and clients, promoting the services offered.
•	Monitor procedural and legal deadlines and hire specialized legal professionals maintaining a balance between customer demand and caseload.
•	Provide advice and counseling to both corporate and individual clients.
•	Prepare lawsuits and represent clients in court proceedings. 
•	Draft and revise contracts (lease, labor, outsourcing, EPC, supply, rebate, service agreement, etc.) for individual clients and corporate clients.
•	Manage follow up on all court/litigation and arbitration procedures.

Results:
•	Built a law firm from scratch to 5 lawyers and a steady client base.
•	Won several health-insurance related lawsuits involving large financial claims.
•	Out of 188 cases, I won 98 cases (still pending 85 and lost 5 cases).
profile_positions.title: Legal Counsel / Lawyer

profile_positions.description:
Fernandez is a medium-sized, B2B corporate law firm serving a variety of corporate clients in the São Paulo region. I joined as junior legal counsel and received my promotion to legal counsel after one year.

Main responsibilities:
•	Provide legal advice, guidance and practical solutions on a variety of topics/issues related to civil law, corporate law and labor law to major clients of this firm.
•	Represent clients (litigation) in court cases in corporate, civil, labor, consumer, social security and family law.
•	Write and revise a variety of legal contracts.
•	Act during hearings and pleadings (appeals, defences) to all Superior Courts.
•	Follow up on litigation and arbitration procedures
•	Provide employment counselling and advice both internally and to external clients.

Results:
•	Prevented a client company from going bankrupt (insolvency lawsuit) that resulted in being able to continue the business and preventing 15 employees from losing their jobs.
•	Won a lawsuit for an ice cream factory that was initiated by a trade union that claimed that this company had failed to implement a specific benefit for employees; I proved that the claim (a huge amount of money) was not correct and that the company had already paid a similar benefit to it’s employees.
•	In a lawsuit where I defended a client (production company) I prevented eviction by the land lord that claimed that the company did not pay (all) monthly rent; client company was able to pay part of the rent in services, pay in instalments and parties agreed on downsizing the rented area reducing the monthly rent that had to be paid by my client and enabling the land lord to attract a new lessee.
profile_positions.title: Legal Counsel / Lawyer

profile_positions.description: During part of this period, I studied at Upper Madison College where I studied English language (English as Second Language) and obtained my certificate. I travelled through Canada before returning to Brazil where I accepted a position with the Fernandez law firm.
profile_positions.title: Student Business & Marketing English

profile_positions.description:
PwC is one of the “Big-4” well known global consultancy firms that offers a complete portfolio of services to its clients including accountancy, tax consultancy and legal counselling. I worked within the international tax and HR practice for clients like Akzo, BP, Telefonica and Rabobank. 

Main responsibilities:
•	Support drafting, revising and writing contractual and other legal documentation, contracts, power of attorney etc.
•	Deliver input on a variety of client questions related to tax, benefits, stock options, equity, compensation, compliance and process management.
•	Maintain contacts with (international) clients as first point of contact and provide follow-up on client requests.
•	Support clients in providing expertise on Brazilian Tax filing requirements.
•	Provide assistance to senior legal counsels and partners of the firm as required.


Results:
•	Drafted and submitted more than 100 Income Tax Return / Central Bank reports for clients during the 60-days “busy season”.
•	As one of 6 trainees, I was the only one who submitted more and complex documents to the fiscal authorities and this resulted in double promotion to Senior Legal Associate.
•	Calculated, drafted and submitted more than 100 tax invoices to clients every month within a 2 days deadline.
•	Regularly worked overtime and during weekends whenever necessary enabling a steep learning curve and contributing to my professional development.
profile_positions.title: Senior Legal Associate

profile_positions.description: At this law firm that has a history of more than 50 years  -specialized in labor law, trade union law and related fields, serving both individual clients and legal entities (such as the Port of Santos, the largest port of Latin America)- I fulfilled my internship (that is part of the law study in Brazil) and was offered a position after completing my internship.
profile_positions.title: Legal Internship / Legal Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: Participated in a summer legal project focused on providing legal advice regarding the right to water to a Dutch NGO named Both Ends in order to help poor communities in Guatemala.
